review_full: I love finding little places like this. Non-touristy, and genuinely good food in a cozy, fun place, just oozing with character. Like most non-Spaniards, we ate dinner early (8:30) and thus, nearly had the whole place to ourselves for an hour (the upside to arriving early is you get more attention and thus better service). By 10pm though, the place was packed. The waitresses were fun and friendly, the food was great, the prices were fantastic. We split a salmon tartar with mango for an appetizer. I had the Milanese Napolitana (veal) which was excellent - so tender and tasty. My husbands argentine steak was very good and the chimichurri sauce was intensely flavorful. Portion sizes are very generous, so be careful not to over-order. Great QPR. I already want to return and try more menu items...especially the salads. 4.5 stars

review_preview: Great find for us.  Farm to table from Azagra south of Pamplona, the family farm ensures fresh vegetables is the highlight.  The warmth and hospitality of the host and family (daughter speaks a little English) makes this fun unpretentious place to enjoy top quality healthy...
review_full: Great find for us. Farm to table from Azagra south of Pamplona, the family farm ensures fresh vegetables is the highlight. The warmth and hospitality of the host and family (daughter speaks a little English) makes this fun unpretentious place to enjoy top quality healthy food. The Gazpacho was unbelievable made with fresh veggies from the family garden. We had artichoke hearts grilled and saut√©ed which was exquisite. Opted for the sirloin over the monkfish with fries was flavorful, gamey and little chewy. Wine list not most extensive but interesting and highlighted some of my favorite regions of Spain including Jumilla and Bierzo. After dinner the owner ran after us to thank us for dinner. I thought very comfortable in modern style. Highly recommended.

review_full: This is my first visit tothis restaurant. It is specialiced in vegetables and this is its strongest point.  Decoration is minimalist, maybe too cold for me. Service is professional and attentive. Everything you ask about vegetables will be optimum and with rather moderate prices. Fish is also very good and portions are very large, but prices are also high. I would recommend to taste several vegetables and to share a portion of fish. Wine list is long and good, but prices also rather high. It could be one of my favorits with more moderate prices. With some reduction schemes like Ell Tenedor or Club Kaviar it would be very attractive. As it is, is only for some special occasions. But it worths to try it.

review_preview: Ok, I'm so excited to tell you all about this restaurant because it was the best experience I had for a long time. I say experience because it was more then just eating, it was a journey to me.First, the restaurant is very fashionable...
review_full: Ok, I'm so excited to tell you all about this restaurant because it was the best experience I had for a long time.  I say experience because it was more then just eating, it was a journey to me. First, the restaurant is very fashionable and design with a great taste.  The ambience is so cool and relaxing... You feel good just sitting there ;) The crew doesn't speak English so much but they are very nice and trying to make you feel comfortable.  As they saw I don't understand something they call someone who dose and she was very nice.  She is an old lady and I think she owns the place.  I don't remember her mane but she explain about the restaurant and the food and each ingredient, where it came from and how they make it, what is special in the ingredients and ask me what do I prefer or if I don't want or like something.  She listen very carefully and understand what I like or don't like and then she offer me the things she think I'd like.   I can tell you guys, she scored it, everything I ate was soooooo good :) The food was amazing and the cooking style was fabulous to me, It took me back 20-30 years to my childhood.  It was so special and tasted so good.  I really recommend this restaurant if you are in Madrid and want to experience the journey I felt.  Bon appetite.

review_full: Do not miss this place if you are in Spain. The lentils are reason enough to go. There is fois in them but they don't really need it. Incredibly savory. They are made with a secret mix of pureed vegetables. Beef chop - get it medium rare, close your eyes and eat it. Some of the best beef I've ever eaten. It is served rare but ignore it. That's the way they serve it in Spain. Scrambled egg fois porcini. Simply an Insane bite of food. Fried artichokes - delicious. Terrific service. Very elegant location. These guys are known as one of the best vegetable restaurants in Madrid. Their extended family runs farms in Navarra, well known for its vegetables.

Michelin know what they are doing and I wonder if the chef here is knocking on the door of a star: it certainly would be well deserved. Thoroughly recommended.

review_preview: We managed to snag the last table for a Thursday evening. As a testament to its popularity, dinners at the restaurant were booked out for the next 2 days. We found out why!The reception, from my phone reservation to the welcome upon arrival, was...
review_full: We managed to snag the last table for a Thursday evening. As a testament to its popularity, dinners at the restaurant were booked out for the next 2 days. We found out why! The reception, from my phone reservation to the welcome upon arrival, was warm and sincere. Seated near the front of the room, I observed the arrival of diners and formed the distinct impression that many, if not all, were regulars. This was a great sign!  Annabelle the co-proprietress guided us through the menu and suggested sharing 3 typical Navarran vegetable dishes. The presentation was unfussy; the focus entirely on the freshness of the ingredients. The grilled suckling pig was heavenly, as was the ox tail stew. Paired with a ripe 2007 Luis Canas, it proved to be an excellent meal. Coffee, dessert and complimentary shots of liqueur prolonged our dinner experience and ensured that our table was a single sitting for the evening. It was easily our best dinning experience in Madrid. Best of all? It's was less than a 300 m easy stroll from our hotel at Innside Madrid Luchana 22 (separate review).

review_preview: What a great place. At the time of writing la manduca is #101 in Madrid. No way is there 100 better places to eat. We ate here on recommendation from the Spanish consulate in the city where we live was not disappointed. We often eat...
review_full: What a great place. At the time of writing la manduca is #101 in Madrid. No way is there 100 better places to eat. We ate here on recommendation from the Spanish consulate in the city where we live was not disappointed. We often eat at Michelin starred restaurants and the food here was equally as good as a 1 star but without alot of the fuss that goes with Michelin restaurants. We were only in Madrid for one night but would of definitely gone back had we been for longer. The Restaurant is really top notch, very modern but still with an rustic feel. The tables were positioned excellently, the atmosphere was fantastic, not to loud but a really nice vibrant buzz, we were there on a Thursday in February and there wasn't one spare table so booking is highly advisable.  The food was amazing. Great choice of meat dishes, fish and great spanish style starters. It is spanish but without being to spanish. I had the sea bass and it was the best fish Ive ever had, perfectly cooked and very fresh. They also have a great selection of vegetable dishes (which i generally find hard to find in Spain). More fine dining food with a small spanish twist we felt. The wine list was very good, good selection of spanish wines at very good price. We had a bottle of alion 2009 and it wasn't marked up much in price from what you can buy in shops yourself. The temperature of the red wine was perfect, you could tell it had been stored correctly in a cellar or temperature controlled wine fridge. Somebody mentioned in one review they were the first to arrive at 930pm, we arrived at 10.15pm and were the last table to arrive. Just Don't. think twice about booking you wont be let down.

Very friendly environment with plenty of delicious options on the menu. When we ordered, we asked for the house red, but the waiter (Alex) brought us a bottle of something better and it paired perfectly with our pasta. We are so happy he took the care to make sure we would love everything about the meal. I could continue, but essentially it was the best dining experience we had in Madrid. If you are looking for Italian, check this place out!

review_preview: We at at the Malatesta on two occasions (a dinner and a lunch), and enjoyed the food both times.  This restaurant seems to always be busy - even when the ones around it are not.  We went the first time for a change from Spanish...
review_full: We at at the Malatesta on two occasions (a dinner and a lunch), and enjoyed the food both times.  This restaurant seems to always be busy - even when the ones around it are not. We went the first time for a change from Spanish cuisine. We had nice salad followed by a terrific pizza. It was good enough to bring us back a couple of days later for lunch and another pizza. Classic thin and crisp base, with toppings that are simple but with great flavour. The restaurant is larger than it first appears. Not too many tables set out in the narrow pedestrian street, but may more inside on the main and basement levels.  The service is OK. They seem to be always rushing, but our food always came out in a reasonable time, as did our drinks orders. They were perfectly happy for us to share dishes. Prices for food and drinks are very reasonable.

All the waiters are extremely well skilled in not noticing a raised hand, and even calling out loud is not that helpful - we had to ask for the check 3 times.  Then I asked the waiter to charge my credit card in Euros, but he made a USD transaction which would initiate a double currency conversion in my bank with a bad exchange rate. The owner refuse to cancel transaction and execute the payment again in Euros, so this dinner will cost me 5-10 EUR more.  Never coming back again.

We had a glass of red Montepulciano and a white, both very good. There is a ‚Ç¨5 supplement for eating outside which we thought ok but maybe shouldn't be charged. A full terrace attracts business inside. With a large bottle of water and bread the bill was ‚Ç¨54.45 which we rounded to ‚Ç¨60and felt it was well worth it for a very enjoyable meal.

review_preview: When we arrived for our early (7:30) dinner reservation we found the upstairs tapas bar jam packed with fun loving patrons enjoying themselves and standing shoulder to shoulder.  We made our way downstairs to the dining room and were greeted by one of the friendliest...
review_full: When we arrived for our early (7:30) dinner reservation we found the upstairs tapas bar jam packed with fun loving patrons enjoying themselves and standing shoulder to shoulder. We made our way downstairs to the dining room and were greeted by one of the friendliest servers I think I ever met! Once we confirmed with her that we had reservations she smiled warmly and hustled to our table with menus. Her smile was one of the best I've had the pleasure to know. We ordered some Amantillado and a glass of red wine. Then we moved on to lentils, duck and foie gras, braised beef and a tomatoes and mozzarella tower. Gradually the room filled with other patrons as we were getting ready to leave not yet being adjusted to the late night dining scene here in Madrid. We had a few pleasant food surprises along the way which I'm sure you will experience too, when you go. This was a great introduction to the Madrid tapas scene. You should definitely go and see for yourself. You'll love it!

The waiters were so great suggesting a variety of tapas for us to try along with great wine selections! The black cannelloni filled with vegetable and seafood was outstanding! The oxtail was delicious and that was our first time having ox tail! Do not miss this culinary delight!

review_preview: This place has been by far the best dining experience I can remember. We were roaming the area for a place to eat late one evening and we stumbled upon this restaurant. We didn't have a reservation and were a tad underdressed for such a...
review_full: This place has been by far the best dining experience I can remember. We were roaming the area for a place to eat late one evening and we stumbled upon this restaurant. We didn't have a reservation and were a tad underdressed for such a posh atmosphere but the staff instantly put us at ease. The decor was simple and minimalistic that was in some way reminiscent of being in a contemporary art museum like the Tate Modern. Yet, the service was so hospitable that it made us feel as though we were in someone's dining room in the countryside of Navarre. And the food was simply outstanding. The artichokes were a bit salty but the rest was awesome including the solomillo. The motto of the restaurant is "Welcome home, consider it yours" and they hold true to that. I didn't walk out of the restaurant, rather I floated because I was amazed by the service; I can never remember any situation as a patron where the proprietor was so genuinely pleased that I visited their establishment and did so in such a down-to-earth manner.

review_preview: 'Manduca' is a Spanish word that translates to 'food' or a synonym thereof. La Manduca restaurant certainly delivers on the promise of food the name holds, but there is so much more. Its stunning moder decor and its unforgettable cuisine makes it an all-around fabulous...
review_full: 'Manduca' is a Spanish word that translates to 'food' or a synonym thereof. La Manduca restaurant certainly delivers on the promise of food the name holds, but there is so much more. Its stunning moder decor and its unforgettable cuisine makes it an all-around fabulous experience. Every bit of food is a unique composition of flavors and it is obvious to anyone that should taste it that it has been prepared with great care, attention, and quality ingredients. The gifts from the kitchen that are brought to each customer add a touch of elegance and shows how much they value their customers. Overall, La Manduca is an excellent dining experience that I recommend for any event, for its environment is suitible for any occasion from family outings to business meetings.

Although the tables in this restaurant are relatively far apart, if there is a large and rowdy party you will definitely hear the noise.

review_preview: We went here in the hope of getting good vegetables in Spain.  We were not disappointed.  It was Saturday night and we think we were the only tourists with the place almost full.The food is from Navarre and they pride themselves on sourcing good...
review_full: We went here in the hope of getting good vegetables in Spain. We were not disappointed. It was Saturday night and we think we were the only tourists with the place almost full. The food is from Navarre and they pride themselves on sourcing good products and are they good at it! We had wonderful beans, the best padron peppers of all time, meluza that melted in the mouth, great prawns and some cheeses from Navarre that were strong and bold just as I love English cheeses. Washed down by a good Navarre wine for just 17 euros a bottle we were really impressed. Spanish cuisine has come on so far. The team that run this place are all stars. It is efficient but firendly and there is real pride in all they do. Congratulations! It is not a cheap place by local standards but we are going back to Madrid next year and we will go here again to try and slightly more meat than fish based menu. Lots of the locals were going for the meats!

review_preview: Dinner at La Manduca de Azagra was one of the most memorable experiences of our entire trip to Spain. We do not eat meat, which severely narrowed the choices available at many Spanish restaurants. Nonetheless, La Manduca was consistently rated as superior on Trip Advisor,...
review_full: Dinner at La Manduca de Azagra was one of the most memorable experiences of our entire trip to Spain. We do not eat meat, which severely narrowed the choices available at many Spanish restaurants. Nonetheless, La Manduca was consistently rated as superior on Trip Advisor, so we decided to take a chance. We were the first patrons to arrive at the restaurant at 21:15. Anabelle, one of the owners, warmly guided us through the menu, in English. She chose the wine for us, and it was very good. Several fish entrees and vegetable first courses made our selection easy. Desert was scrumptious as well. The food was wonderful from start to finish. Annabelle took great care of us throughout the whole meal, as if we were guests in her home.  By the time we finished our meal, the restaurant was packed with diners, many of whom clearly were regular customers. With more people arriving for dinner, we left at 23:30 after a thoroughly top notch meal and cultural experience. Annabelle, personally hailed the cab for us to return to our hotel. This meal was not to be missed.

title_review: Wonderful - respect for the produce and respect for the customer - here is the holy grail!!
review_preview: We visited this restuarant for lunch in February, 2013. We were greeted and welcomed by the owner and seated in a lovely table in a very nice dining room. The lighting is subdued (but not too subdued) and the tables spaced so that one can...
review_full: We visited this restuarant for lunch in February, 2013. We were greeted and welcomed by the owner and seated in a lovely table in a very nice dining room. The lighting is subdued (but not too subdued) and the tables spaced so that one can enjoy a quiet conversation in peace. We noticed that most of the other diners were 'suits' (business people). The food focused on very good produce and home grown vegetables. The artichokes were a revelation. We have never enjoyed artichokes before, they look good but usually taste of... nothing much. These artichokes were prepared in a way that brought out the most amazing flavours. All the food is delicious. Often 'respect for the produce' ends up with dishes that are just plain, unadorned, and 'features' not particularly skilled cooking. Here they transform the produce with some kind of alchemy to make it into something transcendent. We had an excellent lunch and just loved the restaurant. Our jaws dropped when we got the bill - we thought it incredibly reasonable for the quality. Wow, bill shock in reverse. That was a first for us. We were given a heartfelt farewell and even a hug by the owner's wife. Wonderful food, excellent service, beautiful calm surroundings, one of the best experiences we had in Madrid. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. DON'T MISS THIS RESTAURANT.

title_review: How to make your last night in Madrid very special.
review_preview: We heard about Cava Baja and decided to scope out some of the many highly rated restaurants on this street. We popped into the busy Casa Lucas around 9 without a reservation, had a drink at the bar and within 30 minutes we were seated...
review_full: We heard about Cava Baja and decided to scope out some of the many highly rated restaurants on this street. We popped into the busy Casa Lucas around 9 without a reservation, had a drink at the bar and within 30 minutes we were seated and looking at the English menu. We had one of the most special meals we have ever had. We liked it so much we made a reservation for the next night as it was our last night in Spain, we were heading back to Australia. We wanted a guaranteed great last meal in wonderful Spain. So 24 hours later we were greeted with a familiar smile, a shake of the hand by the barman and the lovely waitress who greeted us the night before. We tried something different, and it was equally stunning. There is no point in recommending any one particular dish as they are ALL DELICIOUS. What made these two nights particularly special were the two marvellous hosts who made us feel like we were the most important customers they have ever had. We even got a kiss on the cheek for good luck on our trip home. Madrid hospitality is second to none. Thank you for a wonderful send off ... can't wait to come back to Spain ... and to Casa Lucas.

review_preview: Casa Lucas is a tiny restaurant situated just down from the Plaza Major in Madrid.The restaurant had been recommended following a food tour we had undertaken on our first night and this place from all the bars and restaurants we visited came out top....
review_full: Casa Lucas is a tiny restaurant situated just down from the Plaza Major in Madrid. The restaurant had been recommended following a food tour we had undertaken on our first night and this place from all the bars and restaurants we visited came out top. The service was friendly and informal, the wines by the glass were exceptionally good and also very cheap. The food however, was just outstanding. We enjoyed a fantastic scallop salad with fresh bread, followed by he best oxtail I've ever had. Highly recommended and great value for money. Meal for two with several glasses of wine and bottled water came in at 57 euros.

title_review: Wonderful Little Restaurant in Madrid, Excellent service
review_preview: I was recommended this place by a friend from New Orleans who lives in Madrid.  Went there on a Sunday at 11:30 PM, perhaps the only time the place is not very busy.  Even though the kitchen closes at midnight, we were welcome to sit...
review_full: I was recommended this place by a friend from New Orleans who lives in Madrid. Went there on a Sunday at 11:30 PM, perhaps the only time the place is not very busy. Even though the kitchen closes at midnight, we were welcome to sit down and had our dinner with no sense of rush whatsoever. The place is very small, sits 20 people including the small bar. So make reservations. We ordered two appetizers. The chicken with corn foam and caramelized onions was superb. For main dish we ordered the Tuna Tataki (awesome) and the Octopus with Bacon and mashed potatoes (incredible good). All dishes were excellent, portions are big, very good wines at good prices. Service provided by our waiter Selma was incredible. She is very attentive and always with a smile, made us feel at home. Will definitively go back very soon and will ask for her to be our waitress again. Javier at the bar also did a good job.

The service was attentive enough and friendly, the house red wine was great (as the other reviewers have already mentioned), and they do indeed bring you two shots of limoncello before the bill arrives (not my personal preference, but hey its nice for some). The eggplant melanzane appetizer was definitely our favorite!

We enjoyed lunch, dinner and after dinner ambience appropriate for loners, couples and family as well.

review_preview: My  husband and I spent a month eating our way through Madrid and this was far and away our favorite spot. The modern decor is sophisticated and the tone of the dining rooms serene.  We loved the accent on the vegetables. We were lucky to...
review_full: My husband and I spent a month eating our way through Madrid and this was far and away our favorite spot. The modern decor is sophisticated and the tone of the dining rooms serene. We loved the accent on the vegetables. We were lucky to be there during white asparagus season, but the fresh artichokes were delicious, too (we preferred them boiled to fried). Half portions are available, which is a good idea, since a full serving will pretty much fill all but the most ravenous diner. Were can recommend highly any of the fresh fish offerings, and cornivors should not miss the slow braised bulls tail (which tastes much like a rich, flavorful beef stew). The wine list is filled with affordable, quite delicious, options, while the welcome from owners Juan Miguel Sola and his wife Anabel is gracious and welcoming. If you go, give Anabel a hug for us!

review_preview: This was one of the most memorable dining experiences I've had. My husband and I were in Madrid to celebrate my birthday and I can't think of a lovelier place to have had my birthday dinner. The food was all very fresh and though simply...
review_full: This was one of the most memorable dining experiences I've had. My husband and I were in Madrid to celebrate my birthday and I can't think of a lovelier place to have had my birthday dinner. The food was all very fresh and though simply prepared, extremely flavorful. The room is beautifully lit with tables amply spaced and people who are clearly enjoying themselves. Much of this is due to the extremely warm and helpful service provided by the host and hostess. As Guests whose Spanish is limited, we were greeted and helped along during our meal by the gracious hostess, who couldn't have been nicer. She and her husband chat with and check up on every table throughout the evening. By the time we left, i almost felt as if I had made a friend. I would make a point of returning here if I visit Madrid again.

review_preview: This little bar and cafe has sensational tapas at moderate prices. The service was sensational and the dinning experience was the best. We found this Taberna when we were googling gluten free dining in Madrid. It is was a real treat, for someone who is...
review_full: This little bar and cafe has sensational tapas at moderate prices. The service was sensational and the dinning experience was the best. We found this Taberna when we were googling gluten free dining in Madrid. It is was a real treat, for someone who is gluten intolerant like myself. There was also a menu for my partner who is has no problem with gluten.  The woman serving us was absolutely delightful. I assume from other reviews she was the owner. She was attentive to her customers, but exuded an enthusiasm for her work and the quality of the food. The menu offered choices of nearly 30 different culinary delights. The memorable dishes for us were duck with orange, anchovies with pesto and cheese, salmon salad. The unexpected bonus dessert tapas at the end characterised the thought and consideration that management has given to giving its customers a great experience. This Taberna has been one the outstanding dining experiences of our trip to Madrid this year, and we will return a couple of more times before we leave. There is still many dishes on the menu we would like to savour. The setting is not flash, but rather an honest, friendly Spanish cafe and bar. However, it is a must when visiting the La Latina area of Madrid.

title_review: Great food & good variety of gluten-free tapas
review_preview: Surprisingly, it wasn't that easy to find Gluten-free restaurants in Madrid, if you're not planning and booking in advance. Most venues tell you they don't have any option (even if they serve meat, for example). Few welcome you with a dedicated menu (or an allergens...
review_full: Surprisingly, it wasn't that easy to find Gluten-free restaurants in Madrid, if you're not planning and booking in advance. Most venues tell you they don't have any option (even if they serve meat, for example). Few welcome you with a dedicated menu (or an allergens listing).  Anyway, this restaurant has great food, and a dedicated Gluten-free English menu, which is almost identical to the regular menu. Tapas was tasty, arrived fast, and service was very good and considerate. And in English! Only problem is that it is a small place, so better book ahead (A must during the weekend). The room downstairs is very nicely decorated. Also note many restaurants in Madrid have limited opening hours (lunch time and dinner time), which is a problem for late risers finish breakfast at 11am and look for lunch around 4pm... I think this one is opened from noon till late night.

title_review: Safe Gluten Free Dining with Superb Service
review_preview: La Concha is a charming little tapas bar filled with an upbeat spirit and delicious food!  As one of the first restaurants that my partner and I ate at on our trip to Spain, the dining experience served as a wonderful welcome! To start, I...
review_full: La Concha is a charming little tapas bar filled with an upbeat spirit and delicious food! As one of the first restaurants that my partner and I ate at on our trip to Spain, the dining experience served as a wonderful welcome!  To start, I have to follow a very strict gluten, soy, and corn free diet so eating out can be challenging and stressful. Any concerns regarding cross contamination were quickly alleviated by the ‚ÄúSin Gluten‚Äù decal on the door, indicating that the staff has been trained and certified in proper GF kitchen procedures by the Associacion de Celiacos. Gluten challenged diners can feast here completely confident that they will not be glutened and that, in and of itself, is a joy for me! However, an even more delightful dimension of our dining experience was the extraordinary, accommodating service by our extremely friendly waitress, Beatriz! She warmly welcomed us into the restaurant and then cheerfully took on the challenge of finding foods within my eating restrictions and preferences! While almost all of the items on the menu were possible to have GF with just a bread switch, soy and corn posed a problem within my initial choices. Beatriz worked diligently to find not only safe but tasty creations! Beatriz seemed as happy as I was when she was able to generate three different tapas: one cheese, one anchovy and tomato, and one with lentils and caramelized duck! They were absolutely delicious with their house vino tinto!  This understated, casual tapas bar may not be grand in its size or physical appearance but it is truly special in its people and approach to food. Menu item combinations were more creative than the typical tapas bar. Highly recommended for GF and non GF diners alike!

title_review: Amazing trattoria right off Calle Major
review_preview: My husband and I found this trattoria thanks to good reviews. We are both foodies and enjoy good wine and we were amazed by the simple yet elegant Italian food served. Everything was freshly made and delicious. We started with the eggplant parmigiana that has...
review_full: My husband and I found this trattoria thanks to good reviews. We are both foodies and enjoy good wine and we were amazed by the simple yet elegant Italian food served. Everything was freshly made and delicious.  We started with the eggplant parmigiana that has the right balance of eggplant, tomato sauce and cheese. We then moved to the main course, I had the tagatelli bolognesa and my husband had the Luigi pizza. Both were outstanding; the tagatelli was freshly made with a nice and hearty meat sauce. The pizza crust was super thin and the ham and spicy salami complimented each other nicely. For dessert we shared the tiramisu which was as authentic as anything you would find in Italy; nicely soaked coffee flavoured lady fingers with a fluffy creamy top.  The service was also outstanding. We were given great recommendations and our waiter was nice, friendly and attentive. We will recommend this place to all of our friends and family!

title_review: I almost don't want to share this one, but ....
review_preview: Have visited this restaurant every time I visit Madrid (over 8 times in past year).  Food is excellent.  Service is speedy and not in your face. Perfect home made Italian food as it should be made and served.  Try the buffalo mozzarella (for at least...
review_full: Have visited this restaurant every time I visit Madrid (over 8 times in past year). Food is excellent. Service is speedy and not in your face. Perfect home made Italian food as it should be made and served. Try the buffalo mozzarella (for at least 2 persons as a starter) or the roasted provalone. The home made gnocci bolognese and pizzas are amazing. And the deserts..... You will be in heaven. We're always served by the same waitress (I think her name is Alexandria - it's bad that I don't recall her name but she has a plait/pony tail) and is VERY efficient. A fantastic 3 course meal with wine for 3 people came to around 60 euro. They do have a specials board - give it a go.

review_full: We found this place via recommendations on Trip Advisor whilst in Madrid when we wanted a change from traditional Spanish fare. The restaurant is busy and popular - reserve in advance if you can, or if not, go there about 7pm and ask if you can reserve a table for when they open at 8pm. We were seated in the basement - which was a welcome relief from the 40 degree heat as it was air conditioned, and be aware that they can charge you a supplement for eating outside on the 'terrace'. My fianc√© opted for Pizza, which was tasty and I had the carbonara - good, traditional Italian and nice for a change. Prices are reasonable too.

review_preview: The decor in the restaurant is great - it gives the place a lovely ambiance. The staff were all very friendly, and as our Spanish was very bad we were pleasantly surprised they speak French (I was there with three Frenchies). The menu was varied...
review_full: The decor in the restaurant is great - it gives the place a lovely ambiance. The staff were all very friendly, and as our Spanish was very bad we were pleasantly surprised they speak French (I was there with three Frenchies). The menu was varied with a number of vegetarian options. Some of the dishes had some surprising ingredients, which prompted us to give them a try (the home-made ravioli with chipotle and avocado). All of the food was absolutely delicious - probably the best restaurant I have ever been to, and my friends felt the same. We HAD to have dessert - two were plenty between the four of us - and were again pleasantly surprised by the passionfruit mousse, as we'd never had anything like it before. The 'volcano cake' (moelleux au chocolat) was superb. Just perfect. Definitely recommend giving this place a visit!

review_preview: La Tasqueria restaurant is in the souther part of Chamberi district, very close to the famous Retiro park. The young owner- head chef Javi Est√©vez offers a very interesting and innovative mix of street food and old style Spanish dishes with almost forgotten offal elements....
review_full: La Tasqueria restaurant is in the souther part of Chamberi district, very close to the famous Retiro park. The young owner- head chef Javi Est√©vez offers a very interesting and innovative mix of street food and old style Spanish dishes with almost forgotten offal elements. The local tavern style ground floor dining room has minimalist wooden interior and two big windows with natural light. There were two tasting menus at 50 Euro and 70 Euro as well as an a la carte choice. The meal has begun with appetisers, beef tongue, olives and sourdough bread with olive oil. We have ordered few dishes from the a la carte option. We started with a beef tongue and lobster salad, for second course we had tacos with beef tongue and lobster and third course brioche with roasted lamb and wild mushroom. The salad was very pleasant and refreshing, the tacos were very enjoyable, the beef tong had good flavour and was nicely cooked. The brioche dish had rich flavours, the lamb and the wild mushroom were gently cooked, they went well together. The place was very busy but the staff was attentive, our waitress was friendly and helpful. review_preview: My husband and I ate here on my birthday (the place was recommended to us by our AirBnB hosts) and we were not disappointed.The waitress (apologies, we didn't catch her name but she was Italian and studying politics) was amazing - she spoke to...
review_full: My husband and I ate here on my birthday (the place was recommended to us by our AirBnB hosts) and we were not disappointed. The waitress (apologies, we didn't catch her name but she was Italian and studying politics) was amazing - she spoke to us at length about the restaurant and the menu. She gave us good advice on what to try and we settled for Bife and (I can't remember the other dish but half a cow sums it up!), after an empanada. We even ventured into the world of sweetbreads for the first time ever and we didn't regret it - so moreish! Then at the end, I was presented with a lovely caramel flavoured birthday cake, complete with candle (but thankfully no song!) and it was delicious. The only negative we could possibly place on this was the fact that there were nowhere near enough vegetables to complement the vast amount of meat. I didn't have anything except potatoes so I had to steal some of my husband's peppers. That said, the whole evening was absolutely lovely and we'd definitely recommend the restaurant and go back again next time we're in Madrid (which will absolutely happen!)

title_review: Delicious food, very friendly staff & well priced
review_preview: My girlfriend & I ate here on the last night of our Madrid holiday. The meal was the best of our trip. We had the Empada De Carne & the Chori Al Plato to start - both were lovely. For Main course we had the...
review_full: My girlfriend & I ate here on the last night of our Madrid holiday. The meal was the best of our trip. We had the Empada De Carne & the Chori Al Plato to start - both were lovely. For Main course we had the Bife de Chorizo and the Chipotle Ravioli, the steak was cooked to perfection and the flavour was incredible, it was accompanied by crispy fries which we cooked with garlic oil and dressed in parsley. The ravioli had a lovely spicy kick to it with a tasty pesto sauce and the pasta was cooked Al dente - fantastico! The service was really good, the waiter spoke excellent English and was very attentive and helpful. The restaurant is small however we managed to get a table without any problems. We finished our meal with cappuccinos which were excellent. Overall we were delighted with the meal and will be sure to return if we are ever in Madrid in the future, we will also recommend El Camoati to our friends and family if they are ever in town.

review_full: Hubby and I had dinner at El Camoati on our first night in Madrid, and I had booked the table in advance to be sure of us having somewhere to eat on our first night. I was drawn to El Camoati because it was an Argentinean restaurant, and we love Argentinean food. On arrival we were warmly greeted and shown to our table. The interior design is very quirky, and we were made to feel very comfortable. Other than drinks - a tinto de verano for me and a G&T for my husband, we chose the steak with paprika potatoes and sweet carrots. This was very filling and we had no room for dessert! And the prices are very reasonable too. We were also offered complimentary shots before we left - a nice touch!  Altogether a pleasant introduction to eating out in Madrid. Recommended.

title_review: So good I had to break Dry January
review_preview: Went here with a friend and wow - from the moment we were shown in I knew I would like the place. We chose one of the marble 'sewing machine' tables, with the red velvet coverings on the long seated bench and the soft lighting,...
review_full: Went here with a friend and wow - from the moment we were shown in I knew I would like the place. We chose one of the marble 'sewing machine' tables, with the red velvet coverings on the long seated bench and the soft lighting, together with Lady in Red by Chris de Burgh crooning in the background I was joking about it being the perfect place to go for a date! :-) Whilst we were still chatting and going through the menu (which also has an English section towards the back) the waitress brought us over a complimentary dish - kind of like a flatbread with chutney. My friend ordered red wine and I had been going for two weeks straight on Dry January but I ended up caving in. We split the salmon tartare/mango starter (amazing, and so different to other food I'd had in Spain) and both went for pasta dishes for main course. In fact the food was so good and we were so hungry that we didn't take any photos, but lots of have been posted by other reviewers already. Was so tempted to stay for dessert but we decided to go check out the nearby bars instead! For somewhere that felt like fine dining, the prices were very reasonable. Will definitely return next time I'm in Madrid :)

title_review: My favourite Italian restaurant in Madrid!
review_preview: I lived in Madrid for a year working as an au pair in 2013 and went here all the time.  I also au paired in Sicily before so my expectations on pizza and pasta had been set quite high.  The service and food was exceptional!...
review_full: I lived in Madrid for a year working as an au pair in 2013 and went here all the time. I also au paired in Sicily before so my expectations on pizza and pasta had been set quite high. The service and food was exceptional! I brought all of my friends here as well as my host family. I had no hesitation spending most of my earnings here. I went back to Madrid in the fall of 2015 and of course the food was still on point! The restaurant is located in an open alley off one of the main streets in Sol so it's easy to find and has indoor and outdoor seating. If you're craving some real-deal Italian food...Trattoria Malatesta has got your back! Besos/baci.

title_review: Steak! One of the best I ever had.
review_preview: What a great place! If you want a change after all the tapas and paella: Definitely go here. Situated somewhat anonymously in the quiet street between the lovely and lively Plaza Paya and Plaza de Amillo, we were almost tempted to join the crowd on...
review_full: What a great place! If you want a change after all the tapas and paella: Definitely go here. Situated somewhat anonymously in the quiet street between the lovely and lively Plaza Paya and Plaza de Amillo, we were almost tempted to join the crowd on the terraces. It turned out to be a great decision not to do that. Very friendly staff, with an excellent english speaking waitress - which is a real asset if you spreak Spanish as bad as we do... ;)  The food was excellent: tasty tuna and avocado for starters and hands down one of the best steaks I ever had for maincourse at a very friendly price. We shared a Tiramisu - nice, ok, but I've had better - and an amazing caramel filled pastry with icecream.  Easily the best gastronomic experience during our 4 days in Madrid. Highly recommended.

title_review: Cool local bar with welcoming staff and great vegetarian dinner options
review_preview: I had dinner and a beer there this evening as it's near where I'm staying. My food - a plate each of Parrillada de verduras (grilled veg) and (they kindly gave me a half portion, as they're both mains) Berenjenas con salmorejo (fried crumbed aubergine...
review_full: I had dinner and a beer there this evening as it's near where I'm staying. My food - a plate each of Parrillada de verduras (grilled veg) and (they kindly gave me a half portion, as they're both mains) Berenjenas con salmorejo (fried crumbed aubergine slices with a cheesy, garlicky salmorejo sauce) - was simple but so delicious. In fact it was far better than the vegetarian options in any restaurant I've been to here... including two veggie restaurants. The woman who seemed to be the manager/owner was really helpful in my navigating the menu.  It's a traditional bar that's full of character, and in a cool way. It seems very popular with the younger locals, but was very welcoming to non-local visitors like me too. If I were in Madrid on holiday, rather than by myself for work reasons, I would definitely be having a few beers at this place. Would highly recommend.

review_preview: Arrayan is an intimate restaurant, nicely decorated with fabrics and paintings.The whole experience has been a timeless parenthesis, punctuated by the 7-course menu (60 euros, an excellent price-performance ratio).The chef, Javi CABRERA, sublimates the raw products and revisits traditional Hispanic recipes with modernity...
review_full: Arrayan is an intimate restaurant, nicely decorated with fabrics and paintings. The whole experience has been a timeless parenthesis, punctuated by the 7-course menu (60 euros, an excellent price-performance ratio). The chef, Javi CABRERA, sublimates the raw products and revisits traditional Hispanic recipes with modernity and airy style. Each plate of the 7-course menu shows creativity, marked flavors and simplicity. Our favorites plates were the Himalayan salt, the transcended garlic/almond soup, the bone marrow "trompe l'oeil" and the cod brandade. Carefully selected wines go hand-in-hand with the menu. During the all service, the chef is keen to know the wishes and sensations of his guests and conveys his passion for cooking. No doubt we will book a table at Arrayan next time we are in Madrid. Thank you Javi for your kindness, hospitality and wonderful cooking :-)

I am unfortunately allergic to certain ingredients but the chef takes care of every need. He‚Äôs an artist, and when he came to our table he took care himself about our wellbeing and told us stories about his life and his knowledge about food. So the food is incomparable to any other restaurant in Madrid. The elegant and extravagant mixture of herbs and flavours create a true artistic food experience.  A little later the music and the wine makes you feel like you‚Äôve escaped for a few hours the stressful world just to celebrate one of the most beautiful pleasures. Dinner in company.  Truely not and touristic place and truely for those who love art in any kind!

title_review: good food, but some negative surprises
review_preview: We have been there during Easter Weekend 2019 with my parents in law. In general it is a very good restaurant - nice atmosphere like in a private location and good food. 10 dishes which were tasty. The chef was very friendly. Unfortunately we also...
review_full: We have been there during Easter Weekend 2019 with my parents in law. In general it is a very good restaurant - nice atmosphere like in a private location and good food. 10 dishes which were tasty. The chef was very friendly.  Unfortunately we also had some bad experiences. We all do not speak Spanish and we only had Spanish speaking waitresses, which is our problem, but was a pity as we were never sure of what the dish consists. As the restaurant has no menu, not even in Spanish, we never had a clue what was served. I was very disappointed when we found out at the end of the evening, that there was one English speaking waitress. Why did she not change table with her colleague to serve us? An absolute no go happened with the wine. The chef recommended a white wine and we took a bottle. Sadly we had cork in our wine glasses, what can happen, so we asked for a new bottle. But the waitress poured the wine through a filter in a decanter, which is intolerable. And on top of that our white wine was left in the decanter unchilled the whole evening - this is not acceptable and a disaster for a restaurant in this price range / category.

title_review: Mostly great but I have a suggestion...
review_preview: I've been going to this restaurant for years, mostly because it is near a house I used to live for six years. I enjoy the location, service and atmosphere - the food is usually pretty good too. They are sympathetic to people with children and...
review_full: I've been going to this restaurant for years, mostly because it is near a house I used to live for six years. I enjoy the location, service and atmosphere - the food is usually pretty good too. They are sympathetic to people with children and can handle large groups. I was there yesterday and they have excellent looking desserts too. I have to admit I ordered badly - when the food arrived I had expected something else. They kindly didn't charge me for the dish which in my opinion was inedible - I appreciated that very much, although I was more than prepared to pay as it was my fault for ordering it in the first place. My suggestion is to describe the dishes with more detail. When I read on the menu 'cod with emulsion of black olives' I did not picture an almost raw cold slab of fish on a bed of grey paste surrounded by a lot of cold olive oil and a copious quantity of balsamic emulsion (I hate this stuff, which is often applied liberally to dishes in Spain in a decorative way, and ruins them) topped with onion sprouts and black sesame. I asked them to take the fish off the sauce bed and cook it some more, which they did but when it came back it was still undercooked and the overpowering flavour of the onion sprouts was all wrong. They were kind to take it away, but as my friends dishes had arrived much before mine anyway, by the time all this had happened they had finished their food, so I didn't eat! I am not unhappy as these things sometimes happen. What I would suggest is that they listen to constructive criticism - I don't have a restaurant but I do know food and your dish is over embellished with a strange flavour combination. Also, no-one wants anything grey on their plate. Please don't tell a customer that no-one else has ever not liked it and it's your number one dish - I seriously doubt this but anyway, what's that got to do with anything?

title_review: Simply our best dining experience in all of Spain!
review_preview: After wandering around Madrid checking out menus and trying to find a nice place to have dinner, we stumbled upon La Tragantua.  We didn't have a reservation, but luckily one of the parties who did was a no-show.  Pablo, the chef/owner, welcomed us enthusiastically and...
review_full: After wandering around Madrid checking out menus and trying to find a nice place to have dinner, we stumbled upon La Tragantua. We didn't have a reservation, but luckily one of the parties who did was a no-show. Pablo, the chef/owner, welcomed us enthusiastically and made us feel immediately at home. We loved the atmosphere of this tiny place, and the food was absolutely wonderful. The menu is very eclectic, drawing from east-Asian, italian, traditional Spanish, and Indian cuisines. Wines are very reasonable and well matched for the menu. We had a great evening there, largely due to our gracious host Pablo. We'lll definitely be back!

title_review: #1 in Madrid. And by a wide margin!
review_preview: I've been to Madrid more than 10 times last year on business and I've been to all - or almost all - of the recommended restaurants there. And in my private list La Tragantua is by far the #1 place. I liked I think everything...
review_full: I've been to Madrid more than 10 times last year on business and I've been to all - or almost all - of the recommended restaurants there. And in my private list La Tragantua is by far the #1 place.  I liked I think everything here. The food is just fantastic. But I have to say the steak here was exceptional. I'm a steak fan, I'm very demanding and tough to impress there, but I kid you not: the steak at Tragantua was the best I've ever had. Absolutely.  Pair it with fair prices, cozy atmosphere and super attentive staff (the owner included) and you'll get the whole picture.  An absolute must when you visit Madrid. Just make sure you book your table in advance - the place has rarely any table available without a reservation. At least in the dinner time slot.  Enjoy!

review_full: Following the TripAdvisor advice, we headed off to search for Taberna el Sur. Tucked away on a little street, we were welcomed warmly by the staff and found a table before it started getting busy (about 9:00pm and it was packed by 10pm). Small and cosy, we felt like we were in a local favourite - just what we were looking for. Alex, our waiter, was fantastic! He talked us through in English, made some great recommendations (definitely go for the garlic prawns and the patatas bravas) and looked after us throughout. The barman made great cocktails and we were thrilled with the little shot of digestif after the meal that was given to us. We also ordered the salmon and avocado salad and we were a bit disappointed not to find any avocado in it ... we could've said something but they were getting pretty busy so we just left it. All the rest of the meal and the service was outstanding. If you're looking for a casual, inexpensive place to dine and feel like you're a local, then visit here. Well worth the visit.

review_preview: Small, cosy restaurant where the menu is reassuringly brief and the food delicious.  They do a great sangria and the 'ropa vieja' I'd particularly recommend (shredded beef dish). Because it's small, you often have to sit at the bar while you wait for a table...
review_full: Small, cosy restaurant where the menu is reassuringly brief and the food delicious. They do a great sangria and the 'ropa vieja' I'd particularly recommend (shredded beef dish).  Because it's small, you often have to sit at the bar while you wait for a table and they don't take bookings, but I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes, and the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly.  Everytime I have visitors I bring them here as it's just such a lovely experience. Highly recommendable.

We slipped in, and were greeted by very friendly staff who were considerate and always smiling the whole time.  The menu and food were so good we had our main feed of the day there! Everything we had tasted great, and they even serve locally brewed Brabante craft beer. We popped in fairly close to the end of their lunch opening but they didn't once look as if they were trying to move us along. When we come back we are certainly coming here and will recommend to EVERYONE we know.

title_review: Amazing tapas, traditionally Spanish, great atmosphere
review_preview: My friends and I ate here on two occasions whilst staying in Madrid. It was in walking distance from our apartment and had read a number of positive reviews on Trip Advisor.The restaurant has a traditional Spanish feel to it (in my opinion) and...
review_full: My friends and I ate here on two occasions whilst staying in Madrid. It was in walking distance from our apartment and had read a number of positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The restaurant has a traditional Spanish feel to it (in my opinion) and the atmosphere was buzzing. The service was excellent - although there was a wait for the table, we weren't kept waiting too long.  The food was incredible. The patatas bravas, Mousaka, Iberian Ham plate and Caeser Salad were my choices and they lived up to expectations. All food was reasonably priced and delivered promptly. The waiting staff waited on us attentively, bringing us more drinks and bread. This restaurant is a must visit when in Madrid! The food, service and atmosphere was top notch!
